8.15.17  2:08 pm   i've played piano for several years and have studying singing for more than a year, but in the end all i feel is so tired that almost broken down. i almost cannot remember how i'm deeply touched by music. i don't think there's anything wrong with music. i just wonder if i learned it the wrong way or what. do i not practice enough or not listen carefully enough? how do i find a way to start over?
8.15.17  1:11 pm   Do you think we'll find a form of life that isn't carbon based at some point?

8.15.17  12:40 pm   Why don't you like to be called "Mr.Wurtz"?

     
Also is it OK if I ask the same question multiple times or would that annoy you? (Second time asking)

8.15.17  12:35 pm   Hey i just realised all this time i thought the chords and the melody were the same thing. But since they are different, what exactly are chords and how they function and what makes them support the melody? When i listen to songs i'm starting to pay attention to the instruments and the chords they're playing, but it rarely makes sense to me how they are connected to the melody of the song. This might not be a good question. But i'm just so confused. As a 'songwriter' i'm mostly focused on the vocal melody and lyrics as a result, but i'd like to understand better.

8.15.17  12:13 pm   I think your style of musical surrealistic humour would make an awesome fit for cartoons or something along those lines. Have you, or will you ever considered lending your style to those kinds of projects?
